meanings.sent1: The bird was displumed during molting season.
meanings.sent2: The chicken farmer displumed the rooster before the show.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat displumed the feather duster, thinking it was a toy.
meanings.sent4: The storm displumed the trees, leaving them bare and exposed.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick involved displuming a dove, much to the audience's amazement.

meanings.definition: To deprive of honor or dignity
meanings.sent1: The disgraced knight was displumed of his title and armor.
meanings.sent2: The villain's evil deeds displumed him in the eyes of the townspeople.
meanings.sent3: The prankster displumed the mayor by switching his speech notes with a joke script.
meanings.sent4: The scandalous revelation displumed the once-respected politician.
meanings.sent5: The gossip at school quickly displumed the new student's reputation.
